author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Dollar Weakens as Investors Seek Second Opinion on Inflation
text:
The U.S. dollar edged lower Monday as investors sought confirmation about the pace of inflation after last weekâ€™s weaker-than expected report on wage growth.
The WSJ Dollar Index, which measures the U.S. currency against a basket of 16 others, declined by 0.1% to 83.71. The currency was lower against the euro and the Japanese yen.
